result.execSummary:
The defendant Flavio Gomez-Chontal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
AS TO COUNTS ONE AND TWO, probation to run concurrent as to each count.
*1/7/2016 Probation term commuted on count one commuted to one year.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision and DNA fees out of bail on deposit, if any, and prior to the end of the probationary period. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept.
Maintain full-time/part-time employment and or schooling.

-No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding;
-No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses or drug dealings

-Cooperate with agent;
-Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.

timeConds.notes: Serve 6 months at the Day Reporting Center with release privileges. REPORT DATE 12-07-2015 by 5:00 pm.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Count 1.  STRAIGHT TIME; with credit for 6 days.
Same conditions apply as to Count 1.

miscConds.notes:
-As a convicted felon, defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or we apons at any time in the future.
-Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.
-Deportation rights given.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Flavio Gomez-Chontal

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Denying request for good time credit. Signed and filed.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, for review.  mag
Defendant's pro se request for good time credit.
Per Order signed on 1/7/2016:  the probation term on count one is commuted to one year.
Order Commuting Probation Term signed and filed.  Copies to the District Attorney's Office and Dept of Corrections.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, for review.  mag
DOC request to clarify probation term on count one.
Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Bartholomew.

Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant. Additional statement made by Defendant's wife Alerias G.

AS TO COUNT 1  (Misdemeanor):    Defendant sentenced to serve 1 YEAR, STRAIGHT TIME, in the House of Correction to run concurrent as to Count 2 with credit for 6 days time served.     

AS TO COUNT 2 (Felony):    Defendant sentenced to serve 1 YEAR, STRAIGHT TIME, in the House of Correction to run concurrent as to Count 2 with credit for 6 days time served.   

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2: Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence and placed Defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 YEARS to run concurrent as to each count with the following conditions as to probation:
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*  Cooperate with agent.
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, AND DNA fees out of bail on deposit, if any, and prior to the end of the probationary period.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Maintain full time / part time employment and or schooling.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment.
*  Random urine screens with no positive results.  No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealings.
*  Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.
*  As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons at any time in the future.
*  Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.
*  Deportation rights given.

CONDITION OF PROBATION:  COURT SENTENCED Defendant to serve 6 MONTHS at the Day Reporting Center with release privileges.  REPORT DATE 12-07-2015 by 5:00 pm. 

Received and filed with court:
*  Amended Information
*  Letters/Correspondence
*  DNA Collection Form
*  Sentencing Referral Form
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form

AS TO COUNT 1 (Misdemeanor):    Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

AS TO COUNT 2 (Felony):    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found Defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.

Defendant Flavio Gomez-Chontal in court with attorney Rick David Steinberg.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  On Motion of the State Court AMENDED Count 1 from Possession with the Intent - Cocaine (>5-15g) (Felony)  TO  Possession of Cocaine under Wisconsin Stats. 961.41(3g)(c) a Misdemeanor; and Count 2 Bail Jumping (Felony) under Wisconsin Stats. 946.49(1)(b), 939.50(3)(h).    Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Defendant Flavio Gomez-Chontal in court with attorney Rick David Steinberg.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial, however parties requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Flavio Gomez-Chontal in court with attorney Rick David Steinberg.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial.  Court grants Defense motion for adjourned final pre-trial.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Flavio Gomez-Chontal in court with attorney Rick David Steinberg.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case in court for scheduling conference, defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.
For reasons stated on the record, cash bail is reinstated with all the same conditions.

Attorney Rick David Steinberg in court, defendant Flavio Gomez-Chontal not in court, in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Return on bench warrant held. Bail hearing proceeded. Arguments by counsel.  Defense requests scheduling date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant missed court on 09/03/2015.  Defendant is currently in custody on warrant.  Case is adjourned for a Return on Warrant on 09/04/2015 at 8:30am, in Branch 22.  Parties notified.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Attorney Rick David Steinberg in court.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

Defendant Flavio Gomez-Chontal in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status of counsel, however State Public Defender's office was not able to appoint another Spanish speaking attorney and requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Johnson informs court that she has a conflict of interest.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Jury trial date of 08/26/2015 is vacated.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 22.

Defendant Flavio Gomez-Chontal in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Alexandra Wirth.  Status conference scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Case in court for final pre-trial,  case adjourned to investigate a potential conflict of interest.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.   Final pre-trial scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Case calendared for Miranda/Goodchild Hearing, however, the State no longer wishes to use the statement in question. Court orders hearing vacated. State requests permission to file an amended information. Court orders the amended Information be filed by the final pre-trial date and that negotiations for a resolution continue. Case remains calendared for a final pre-trial 8/14/15 and jury trial 8/26/15.

One of the State's witnesses for the Miranda/Goodchild hearing is unavailable. There are issues with taking a staement from an individual who came forward in this matter. Court grants defense request for an adjournment. Case calendared for MOTION HEARING on 7/17/2015 at 1:30 pm, FINAL PRETRIAL on 8/14/2015 at 8:30 am and JURY TRIAL on 8/26/2015 at 9:00 am in Branch 15. Motion hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.

There is also an issue with a 3rd party statment and the State has not interviewed that party. Defense filed a motion to suppress statements on todays date which will be heard on 4/6/2015.

Defendant Flavio Gomez-Chontal in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files a Notice of Motion and Motion to Adjourn the trial date.  Defense counsel just appointed to the case and will not be regard for the trial currently scheduled for 2-2-15.  Motion to adjourn granted.  Court informed defense that any motions that need to be filed must be done by February 2, 2015.  Matter scheduled for a final pretrial/projected guilty plea and jury trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.
